org.opensha.eq.fault.surface

Class StirlingGriddedSurface

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opensha.eq.fault.surface.Container2DImpl<Location>
      • org.opensha.eq.fault.surface.AbstractEvenlyGriddedSurface
        • org.opensha.eq.fault.surface.AbstractEvenlyGriddedSurfaceWithSubsets
          • org.opensha.eq.fault.surface.EvenlyGriddedSurfFromSimpleFaultData
            • org.opensha.eq.fault.surface.StirlingGriddedSurface
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Location>, Container2D<Location>, EvenlyGriddedSurface, RuptureSurface, Named

    public class StirlingGriddedSurface
extends EvenlyGriddedSurfFromSimpleFaultData
    Title: StirlingGriddedSurface.
    Description: This creates an EvenlyGriddedSurface representation of the fault using a scheme described by Mark Stirling to Ned Field in 2001, where grid points are projected down dip at an angle perpendicular to the end-points of the faultTrace (or in aveDipDir if provided using the appropriate constructor).
    Author:
    Ned Field.

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      • Fields inherited from class org.opensha.eq.fault.surface.Container2DImpl

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StirlingGriddedSurface(LocationList faultTrace, double aveDip, double upperSeismogenicDepth, double lowerSeismogenicDepth, double gridSpacing)
      This applies the grid spacing exactly as given (trimming any remainder from the ends), and applies the ave-dip direction as computed from the faultTrace.
      StirlingGriddedSurface(LocationList faultTrace, double aveDip, double upperSeismogenicDepth, double lowerSeismogenicDepth, double gridSpacing, double aveDipDir)
      This applies the grid spacing exactly as given (trimming any remainder from the ends), and applies the given ave-dip direction (rather than computing this from the the faultTrace).
      StirlingGriddedSurface(SimpleFaultData simpleFaultData, double gridSpacing)
      This applies the grid spacing exactly as given (trimming any remainder from the ends)
      StirlingGriddedSurface(SimpleFaultData simpleFaultData, double maxGridSpacingAlong, double maxGridSpacingDown)
      This will fit the length & DDW of the fault exactly (no trimming) by adjusting the grid spacing to just below the grid spacings given

      • resampleTrace

        public static LocationList resampleTrace(LocationList trace,
                         int num)
        This resamples the trace into num subsections of equal length (final number of points in trace is num+1). However, note that these subsections of are equal length on the original trace, and that the final subsections will be less than that if there is curvature in the original between the points (e.g., corners getting cut).
        Parameters:
        trace -
        num - - number of subsections
        Returns:
